page.title: 08DAIRY HERD II.
page.content: The milk is piped to a filter which removes hairs and straw,etc.,then to a cooler before passing into a Stainless Steel vat which can hold 4000 gallons. Tankers from the Dairy collect the milk daily.After each milking,the cows udder is sprayed with insect repellent to prevent infection from flies. The Dairyman also breeds and rears his own stock.Day old calves are taken from the mother and fed on milk. The calves are weaned onto pellets and then changed onto{Wheat}or{Barley } before being let out to the pastures. Male calves are sold when they are older.The females join the herd. The cow is put back with the herd and a young Hereford bull grazes nearby to make her more receptive to {ARTIFICIAL INSEMINATION,}and in 9 months time,she will,hopefully,bear another calf.
